frameAttributes.name: first grab
frameAttributes.description: Identify when the needle is first grabbed.

instructions.shortInstruction:
On each frame, choose the points for the ends of the graspers, the body of the grasper, the needle end, and needle tip.  
Additionally, on one frame per video, identify the first time the needle was grabbed with the frame attribute.
instructions.fullInstruction:
• Use the navigation bar in the bottom-left corner to see all video frames included in this task. Label each frame. If an object or person appears in more than one frame, use the same Label ID for that object in each frame.To label an object or person, select the appropriate category from the Label categories menu, and then use the keypoint tool to draw a keypoints around it. A keypoint is a single point that you place on an object or person. When you place a keypoint, it cannot be moved. You can delete a keypoint by selecting it and then selecting Delete. 
  • Use the Copy to next icon, or the shortcut command N on your keyboard, to have the user interface copy all selected keypoints (or all keypoints if none are selected) in the current frame to the next frame. Use the Copy to remaining frames icon, or A on your keyboard to copy all selected or all keypoints to all subsequent frames. 
  • After you add a keypoint, select the associated label in the Labels menu to add label attributes, if applicable.
  • Use the Shortcuts menu to see keyboard shortcuts that you can use to label objects faster.
  • Use this resource to learn about worker portal navigation, tools available to complete your task, icons, and view options.
